metadata.title: CVE-2016-10192 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in ffserver.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.10, 3.0.xbefore 3.0.5, 3.1.x before 3.1.6, and 3.2.x before 3.2.2 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging failure to check chunksize.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.2-2
libav-tools - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.2-2').
